programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S02 E01 - Currents
programme.desc: Hundreds of millions of years of volcanic activity, isolation and powerful currents have shaped Antarctica and its surrounding islands into varied and fascinating terrains.

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S02 E02 - Seasons
programme.desc: Every animal in Antarctica answers the call of the seasons, and the continent itself is vastly different in Summer and Winter.

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S02 E03 - Connected Continents
programme.desc: Antarctica was once the centre of the ancient southern supercontinent, Gondwana. Traces of these connections remain throughout the southern hemisphere today: in plants and marine species with similarities that have long-ago changed and adapted to the environment around them.

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S02 E04 - Icy Islands
programme.desc: When it’s time to haul ashore for breeding, mating and raising young, marine mammals return from the Antarctic Peninsula to island beaches in the middle of the South Atlantic oceans.

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S03 E01 - Outback Deserts
programme.desc: Australia’s vast interior is dry: nearly a fifth is classified as desert. With little rainfall and temperatures soaring above 50 degrees Celsius, it’s an unrelenting habitat. But these arid areas are also surprisingly varied, and can be breathtakingly spectacular.

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S03 E02 - Rainforests
programme.desc: Some of the world’s most ancient and ecologically diverse rainforests are in Australia: from the oldest tropical rainforest on earth, North Queensland’s Daintree, to the stunning central highlands of Tasmania in the far south.

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S03 E03 - Bush
programme.desc: Australia’s semi-coastal interior is vastly referred to as ‘the bush’. These forested tracts are lush and varied, coloured by extraordinary landscapes and wildlife found nowhere else on the planet.

programme.title: Wildest Places
programme.sub-title: Wildest Places S03 E04- Coast
programme.desc: Australia has more than 35,000 kilometers of coastline. From broad, sandy beaches to towering cliffs and mangrove swamps, Australia’s coast can be a strange mix of soil and sea; rainforest and reef.

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.sub-title: Walks of Life S01 E01 - Lakes
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig explores the magnificent Lake District in a journey inspired by the work of the region’s most famous son, William Wordsworth.

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.sub-title: Walks of Life S01 E02 - River Severn
programme.desc: JB Gill journeys along a 12 mile stretch of the River Severn in Shropshire to discover the ways civilisations have lived and worshipped along its banks since the dawn of man.

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.sub-title: Walks of Life S01 E03 - Braemar
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig ventures into the Highlands to enjoy the spectacular Cairngorm National Park.

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.sub-title: Walks of Life S01 E04 - Dartmoor
programme.desc: JB Gill explores the mysterious landscape of Dartmoor, finding out how people have been finding solace and wellbeing amongst its extraordinary scenery for centuries.

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.sub-title: Walks of Life S01 E05 - Kent
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig explores the gorgeous Kent countryside as she walks in the footsteps of the county’s most famous son, Charles Dickens.

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.sub-title: Walks of Life S01 E06 - Edinburgh
programme.desc: JB Gill heads North of the Border to explore the hidden secrets that can be found amongst the familiar tourist sites of Edinburgh.

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.sub-title: Walks of Life S01 E07 - Lichfield
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig is in stunning Staffordshire, walking the final section of the Two Saints Way, an ancient pilgrim trail that ends at the Shrine of St Chad near the magnificent Lichfield Cathedral.

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.sub-title: Walks of Life S01 E08 - Cornwall
programme.desc: JB Gill explores the beautiful county of Cornwall to find out how the dramatic landscape shapes the lives and beliefs of the people who live there.

programme.title: Lost Kingdoms of Africa
programme.sub-title: Lost Kingdoms of Africa - The Kingdom of Asante
programme.desc: Asante in West Africa was a kingdom that was built on gold and slaves, which ensured its important place in an economy that linked three continents.

programme.title: Lost Kingdoms of Africa
programme.sub-title: Lost Kingdoms of Africa - The Zulu Kingdom
programme.desc: In South Africa, Gus Casely-Hayford visits evocative sites in Zulu history and searches for the secrets behind the Zulu's cultural power and military strength.

programme.title: Lost Kingdoms of Africa
programme.sub-title: Lost Kingdoms of Africa - The Berber Kingdom of Morocco
programme.desc: Gus Casely-Hayford visits Morocco, once the centre of a vast kingdom created by African Berbers that stretched from northern Spain to West Africa.

programme.title: Lost Kingdoms of Africa
programme.sub-title: Lost Kingdoms of Africa - Bunyoro and Buganda
programme.desc: Gus Casely-Hayford visits Uganda to explore how Bunyoro saw its dominance challenged by the rise of Buganda, a neighboring kingdom on the shores of Lake Victoria.

programme.title: Lost Kingdoms of Central America
programme.sub-title: Lost Kingdoms of Central America - Kingdom of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Dr. Jago Cooper journeys through Southern Mexico to investigate the rise and fall of America's oldest civilization, the Olmec, who thrived over 3000 years ago.

programme.title: Lost Kingdoms of Central America
programme.sub-title: Lost Kingdoms of Central America - The People Who Greeted Columbus
programme.desc: The Taino, the first people of the Americas to greet Christopher Columbus, had an amazing multicultural society complete with drug infused rituals, strange skulls and amazing navigation.
